title: Cali A. Wilson
text:
When I’m not analyzing data or observing birds, I enjoy paddle boarding, camping, and hiking with my dog Lambeau.

  Click for photo of Lambeau on the paddle board!

title: Projects
text:
My PhD dissertation focuses on addressing how behavioral responses to urbanization affect wildlife pathogen dynamics.
I am addressing this question in multiple ways and using the American white ibis system in South Florida as a study system.
Project 1: How does variation in urbanization and human-provided food influence white ibis behaviors relevant to transmission?
I address this with 3 main questions:

How do white ibis activity budgets differ between urban and natural environments?
What factors influence variation in behavior across urban sites?
How does provisioning affect ibis flock density and contact?

How do white ibis activity budgets differ between urban and natural environments?

Project 2: Modeling the effects of food provisioning and personality variation in wildlife on infection dynamics
Project 3: Examining drivers of aggression in an urban wading bird
Project 4: Review and synthesis of behavioral heterogeneity and animal-pathogen dynamics in urban landscapes
